chapter.p: 1The word that Yahweh spoke concerning Babylon, concerning the land of the Chaldeans, by the hand of Jeremiah the prophet:

ul.li1: 2“Declare among the nations and proclaim,
ul.li2: and lift up a banner.
ul.li1: Proclaim, you must not conceal it.
Say, ‘Babylon is captured,
ul.li2: Bel is ashamed,
Merodach is filled with terror,
ul.li1: her idols are ashamed,
ul.li2: her idols are filled with terror.
ul.li1: 3For a nation will come up against her from the north.
It will make her land as a horror,
ul.li2: and an inhabitant will not be in her.
ul.li1: From humansHebrew “human” to animalsHebrew “animal” they all will wander off.
ul.li2: They will go away.
ul.li1: 4In those days and in that time,’ ” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh,
ul.li2: “the peopleOr “sons/children” of Israel will come,
they and the peopleOr “sons/children” of Judah together.
ul.li1: Weeping as they go,Literally “They shall go and weeping” they will go,
ul.li2: and Yahweh their God they will seek.
ul.li1: 5They will ask the way to Zion,
ul.li2: turning their faces there.
ul.li1: They will come and join themselves to Yahweh
ul.li2: by an everlasting covenantLiterally “a covenant of eternity” that will not be forgotten.
ul.li1: 6My people have become lost sheep,
ul.li2: their shepherds have caused them to go astray.
ul.li1: They led them away to the mountains.
From mountain to hill they have gone,
ul.li2: they have forgotten their resting place.
ul.li1: 7All those who found them have devoured them.
ul.li2: And their foes have said, ‘We are not guilty,
ul.li1: becauseLiterally “under that” they have sinned against Yahweh, the true pasture,Literally “settlement of righteousness”
ul.li2: even Yahweh, the hope of their ancestors.’Or “fathers”
ul.li1: 8Flee from the midst of Babylon,
ul.li2: and from the land of the Chaldeans.
ul.li1: Go out and be like he-goats
ul.li2: beforeLiterally “to the face of” the flock.
ul.li1: 9For look, I am going to stir up,
ul.li2: and I am going to bring against Babylon
ul.li1: a contingent of great nations
ul.li2: from the land of the north.
ul.li1: And they will draw up a battle formation against her,
ul.li2: from there she will be captured.
ul.li1: Their arrows are like a warrior who has achieved success,
ul.li2: he does not return without success.
ul.li1: 10And Chaldea will be as booty,
ul.li2: all those who plunder her will be satisfied,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.
ul.li1: 11“Though you rejoice, though you exult,
ul.li2: O plunderers of my inheritance,
ul.li1: though you frisk about like a heifer on the grass,
ul.li2: and you neigh like the powerful stallions,
ul.li1: 12your mother will be very ashamed.
ul.li2: She who gave birth to you will be humiliated.Or “ashamed”
ul.li1: Look, she will be the least of the nations,
ul.li2: a desert,Or “wilderness” dry land, and wilderness.Or “Arabah”
ul.li1: 13Because of the anger of Yahweh she will not be inhabited,
ul.li2: but she will be a wasteland, all of her.
ul.li1: Everyone who passes by Babylon will be appalled
ul.li2: and will hiss because of all her wounds.
ul.li1: 14Draw up a battle formation at Babylon all around,
ul.li2: all those who bend the bow, shoot at her.
ul.li1: You must not spare arrows,Hebrew “arrow”
ul.li2: for she has sinned against Yahweh.
ul.li1: 15Raise a war cry against her on all sides.
ul.li2: She has surrendered.Literally “She has given her hand”
ul.li1: Her towers have fallen,
ul.li2: her walls are ruined.
ul.li1: For this is the vengeance of Yahweh.
ul.li2: Take revenge on her.
ul.li1: As she has done to others,
ul.li2: so do to her.
ul.li1: 16Cut off the sower from Babylon,
ul.li2: and the one who uses the sickle in the time of harvest.
ul.li1: Because ofLiterally “From the face of” the sword of the oppressor
ul.li2: each one will turn to their people,
and each one will flee to their land.
ul.li1: 17Israel is a sheep scattered,
ul.li2: lions drove them away.
ul.li1: The first who devoured it was the king of Assyria,
ul.li2: and now at the end Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, gnawed its bones.”

chapter.p: 18ThereforeLiterally “To thus” thus says Yahweh of hosts, the God of Israel,

ul.li1: “Look, I am going to punish the king of Babylon and his land
ul.li2: just as I punished the king of Assyria.
ul.li1: 19And I will restore Israel to its pasture,
ul.li2: and it will feed on Carmel, and in Bashan,
ul.li1: and on the hillsHebrew “hill” of Ephraim, and in Gilead
ul.li2: its hunger will be satisfied.
ul.li1: 20In those days and at that time,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh,
ul.li2: “the guilt of Israel will be sought, but there is none,
ul.li1: and the sins of Judah, but they will not be found,
ul.li2: for I will forgive those I left behind.
ul.li1: 21To the land of Merathaim,
ul.li2: go up against her,
ul.li1: and against the inhabitants of Pekod,
ul.li2: massacre and destroy them,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh,
ul.li1: “and do according to all that I have commanded you.
22The sound of battle is in the land,
ul.li2: and great destruction.
ul.li1: 23How the blacksmith’s hammer of all the earth is cut down and broken!
ul.li2: How Babylon has become as a horror among the nations!
ul.li1: 24I laid a bird snare for you, and you were caught, O Babylon.
ul.li2: But you yourself did not know.
ul.li1: You were discovered and seized,
ul.li2: because with Yahweh you measured yourself.
ul.li1: 25Yahweh has opened his armory,
ul.li2: and he has brought out the weapons of his wrath,
ul.li1: for it is a word for my Lord Yahweh of hosts
ul.li2: in the land of the Chaldeans.
ul.li1: 26Come against her from the end,
ul.li2: open her granaries.
ul.li1: Pile her up like heaps and destroy her.
ul.li2: Let there be no remnant for her.
ul.li1: 27Massacre all her bulls,
ul.li2: let them go down to the slaughtering.
ul.li1: Woe to them, for their day has come,
ul.li2: the time of their punishment.
ul.li1: 28There is the sound of fugitives and survivors
ul.li2: from the land of Babylon,
ul.li1: to declare in Zion the vengeance of Yahweh our God,
ul.li2: the vengeance for his temple.
ul.li1: 29Summon archers against Babylon,
ul.li2: all those who bend the bow.
ul.li1: Encamp all around her,
ul.li2: there must not be for her an escape.
ul.li1: Take revenge on her according to her deeds.
ul.li2: According to all that she has done, so do to her.
ul.li1: For against Yahweh she has behaved insolently,
ul.li2: against the Holy One of Israel.
ul.li1: 30ThereforeLiterally “To thus” her young men will fall in her public squares,
ul.li2: and all her soldiersLiterally “her the men of war” will perish on that day,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.
ul.li1: 31“Look, I am against you, O arrogant one,”
ul.li2: declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Lord Yahweh of hosts,
ul.li1: “for your day has come,
ul.li2: the time when I will punish you.
ul.li1: 32And the arrogant one will stumble and fall,
ul.li2: and there is no one who raises him up.
ul.li1: And I will kindle a fire in his cities,
ul.li2: and it will devour everything around him.”

ul.li1: “The peopleOr “sons/children” of Israel are oppressed,
ul.li2: and the peopleOr “sons/children” of Judah likewise,
ul.li1: forLiterally “and” all their captors have seized them,
ul.li2: they refuse to let them go free.
ul.li1: 34Their redeemer is strong,
ul.li2: his name is Yahweh of hosts.
ul.li1: Surely he will plead their case,
ul.li2: in order to make peace for the earth,
ul.li1: but to cause unrest to the inhabitants of Babylon.
35A sword against the Chaldeans,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh,
ul.li2: “and against the inhabitants of Babylon,
ul.li1: and against her officials,
ul.li2: and against her wise men.
ul.li1: 36A sword against the oracle priests,
ul.li2: and they will become foolish.
ul.li1: A sword against her warriors,
ul.li2: and they will be filled with terror.
ul.li1: 37A sword against his horses,
ul.li2: and against his chariots,Hebrew “chariot”
ul.li1: and against all the foreign troops who are in the midst of her,
ul.li2: so that they may become as women.
ul.li1: A sword against her treasures,
ul.li2: so that they may be plundered.
ul.li1: 38A drought will come against her waters,
ul.li2: and they will dry up,
ul.li1: for it is a land of images,
ul.li2: and because of the frightful objects, they act like madmen.
ul.li1: 39ThereforeLiterally “To thus” desert creatures will live thereHere the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation with jackals,
ul.li2: and daughters of ostrichesHebrew “ostrich” will inhabit her.
ul.li1: And she will not be inhabited again forever,Literally “to eternity”
ul.li2: and she will not be dwelt in for all generations.Literally “until generation and generation”
ul.li1: 40As when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah
ul.li2: and their neighbors,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh,
ul.li1: “no one will live there,
ul.li2: and the son of humankind will not dwell as an alien in her.
ul.li1: 41Look, a people is about to come
ul.li2: from the north,
ul.li1: and a great nation and many kings are woken up
ul.li2: from the remotest part of the earth.
ul.li1: 42They keep hold of bow and short sword.
ul.li2: They are cruel and they have no mercy.
ul.li1: Their sound is like the sea, it roars,
ul.li2: and upon horses they ride.
ul.li1: Drawn up for battle as a man for the battle,
ul.li2: against you, O daughter of Babylon.
ul.li1: 43The king of Babylon heard their report
ul.li2: and his hands grew slack.
ul.li1: Anxiety has seized him,
ul.li2: fear and pain like the woman who gives birth.
ul.li1: 44Look, like a lion he comes up from the thicketsHebrew “thicket” of the Jordan
ul.li2: against a pastureland by a constantly flowing stream,Literally “a pasture of ever-flowing”
ul.li1: so I will chase them away quicklyLiterally “I will do in an instant I will cause them to run” from her,
ul.li2: and I will appoint whoever is chosen over her.
ul.li1: For who is like me, and who can summon me,
ul.li2: and who is this shepherd who can stand before me?Literally “to the face of me”
ul.li1: 45ThereforeLiterally “To thus” hear the plan of Yahweh
ul.li2: that he has planned against Babylon,
ul.li1: and his plans
ul.li2: that he has planned against the land of the Chaldeans.
ul.li1: SurelyLiterally “If not” they will drag them away,
ul.li2: the little ones of the flock.
ul.li1: SurelyLiterally “If not” he will cause their grazing place
ul.li2: to be desolate over them.
ul.li1: 46At the sound, ‘Babylon has been captured,’
ul.li2: the earth will quake,
ul.li1: and a cry for help among the nations
ul.li2: will be heard.”
